conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the sled and child system.
Weight of the child and sled is given by (m_child + m_sled)g.
Mass of the child m_child = 30 kg.
Mass of the sled m_sled = 10 kg.
Total weight W = m_total g = 40 x 10 = 400 N.
Pulling force F is applied at an angle theta = 37 degrees above the horizontal.
Magnitude of the pulling force F = 100 N.
Vertical component of the pulling force F sin theta = 100 x 0.6 = 60 N.
Horizontal component of the pulling force F cos theta = 100 x 0.8 = 80 N.
Normal force N is the force exerted by the ground on the sled, which balances the vertical components of the forces.
Since the sled moves at a constant speed, the net force in the vertical direction must be zero.
Normal force N = W - F sin theta = 400 N - 60 N = 340 N.
Magnitude of the pressure exerted by the sled on the ground is 340 N.
